t: An*pn attacker advances against you, Nineveh. Guard*ld the fortress, watch*ld the road, brace*ld yourselves, marshal*ld all your strength!
The*pn Lord*s will restore the splendor of Jacob like*ld the splendor of Israel, though*ln destroyers have laid them waste and*ld have ruined their vines.
The*pn shields of the soldiers are red; the*ld warriors are clad in scarlet. The*ln metal on the chariots flashes on*ld the day they are made ready; the*ld spears of juniper are brandished.
The*ln chariots storm through the streets, rushing*ld back and forth through the squares. They*ln look like flaming torches; they*ld dart about like lightning.
Nineveh*pn summons her picked troops, yet*ld they stumble on their way. They*ln dash to the city wall; the*ld protective shield is put in place.
The*ln river gates are thrown open and*ld the palace collapses.
It*ln is decreed that Nineveh be*ld exiled and carried away. Her*ln female slaves moan like doves and*ld beat on their breasts.
Nineveh*ln is like a pool whose*ld water is draining away. “Stop!*ln Stop!” they cry, but*ld no one turns back.
Plunder*ln the silver! Plunder*ld the gold! The*ln supply is endless, the*ld wealth from all its treasures!
She*ln is pillaged, plundered, stripped! Hearts*ld melt, knees give way, bodies*ld tremble, every face grows pale.
Where*pn now is the lions’ den, the*ld place where they fed their young, where*ln the lion and lioness went, and*ld the cubs, with nothing to fear?
The*ln lion killed enough for his cubs and*ld strangled the prey for his mate, filling*ln his lairs with the kill and*ld his dens with the prey.

“I*pn am against you,” declares*ld the Lord*s Almighty. “I*ln will burn up your chariots in smoke, and*ld the sword will devour your young lions. I*ld will leave you no prey on the earth. The*ln voices of your messengers will*ld no longer be heard.”
